title: Girl in Lavender, Seated at a Desk
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. John J. McDonough
provenance_text:
Theodore Earl Butler [1860-1936], Giverny, France; Michel Monet, Giverny, France. Janet Fleisher Gallery, Philadelphia, PA, by March 1965 until 1967; Dr. Albert Kaplan, Philadelphia, PA; sale, Samuel T. Freeman and Company, Philadelphia, PA, April 20, 1978; Dr. and Mrs. John J. McDonough, Youngstown, OH, 1978 until December 1982 [1]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1982 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Provenance according to "American Paintings and Sculpture to 1945 in the Carnegie Museum of Art," pages 119-120. 
[2]. The painting, a year-end gift in 1982, was on tour as part of the exhibition "Directions in American Painting, 1875-1925: Works from the Collection of Dr. and Mrs. John J. McDonough" at the time of the gift. It was accessioned in February 1983. See correspondence in curatorial file.
